hook.text: A fully 3D-printed dress walked the Met Gala red carpet. It was made from zero fabric.

buildup.text: 3D printing builds garments layer by layer, using only the exact material neededâ€”no cutting waste.

discovery.text: Designers now print with recycled plastics, bio-resins, and even biodegradable polymers.

twist.text: The catch: 3D-printed clothes are stiff, expensive, and take hours to make. Mass market is years away.

climax.text: As the tech matures, it could eliminate fabric waste entirely and enable on-demand local production.

punchline.text: No scissors, no scraps. Fashion's future may be printed.

quiz.question: What is a major advantage of 3D-printed garments over traditional manufacturing?
options: They are currently cheaper to produce than conventionally sewn clothes
They use only the exact material needed, producing zero cutting waste
They are softer and more comfortable than traditionally woven fabrics
